title: Casual [2]
content:
now with capital letters..

[http://www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual\_caps1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724050452/http:/www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual_caps1.gif "http://www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual\_caps1.gif")

[http://www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual\_caps2.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724050452/http:/www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual_caps2.gif "http://www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual\_caps2.gif")

not sure about some letters (m, n) but i like it like this.

the whole charmap of the lower case letters:

[http://www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual2.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724050452/http:/www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual2.gif "http://www.art.ificial.ch/mixed%20temporary/casual2.gif")
author: thierry blancpain

comments.content:
Thierry, The uppercase characters may seem too condensed / narrow, compared to the lowercase.. _( For further inspiration on your upper, and your lower case, you may want to take a look at ' [Huit](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724050452/http:/perso.wanadoo.fr/les.besnardtypo/typographies/typographies/huit_sargon.html)', by Roselyne & Michel Besnard.. )_

( And why did you start a new thread, instead of posting this as a reply to the ' [original](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724050452/http:/typophile.com/node/13236)' one.? :)
I think you've got a problem of the R looking too much like the A and the B looking like an 8. Using your treatment of the K might solve it.
